text: so this talk is something completely
different from most tech talks you'll
see at technology conferences like this
one this talk is aligned with how people
work together what does collaboration
look like when it's working what does it
look like when it's not working and what
can somebody do about it in those
situations the stories that I try and
tell and by the way stories are the most
important part of everything I talk
about in this in this talk um the
stories I tell are about real life
situations where um I can show you how
certain moderators in
behavior um Can inform a better
environment where people can collaborate
in a more healthy and Powerful way now
that sounds like a lot of consultancy
speak so let's drill it down to what
what I mean by by that I've actually got
a number of why cool mod uh modulators
that I work towards these are things
that I have in mind and I apply sort of
complexity Theory to this because I see
the way that people work on software
systems it's a complex socio technical
environment so that nature of that
environment means we can't just go in
and go do this differently and it will
be better because if we do we're
completely context ignorant and usually
do more harm than good so what I do is I
take these mod these sort of um
moderators these modulators that are
things I like to tell more stories in my
life about these modulators are grit
they are
residuality they are anti fragility
their psychological safety their
empathy together those sound pretty much
like a shopping list of consultancy and
coaching Jazzy terms but because they
are just modulators they're the things I
take each of those and I say what
stories do I want in my life and my
interactions with my colleagues in my
teams what stories do I want more of
that that are related to those things
and what stories do I want less of and
so what I do is I adopt different skills
and behaviors based off of each of these
modulators to get me to a point where
I'm telling more stories about how
people were resilient how people were
supportive how people how I affected
someone else in a positive way how
empathy informed a particular set of
interactions now I learned all these
lessons through probably one of the
biggest incidents in my life and I want
to be careful with the word incident so
I I'm a big fan of learning from
incidents I'm also a big fan of learning
anyway but incidents is a particularly
powerful way doing it when it comes to
learning from incidents the first thing
you need to know about an incident is
it's a surprise
incidents can be planned game days are
planned we come up with these things and
go it might go wrong on this date and
this way at this time and that is sort
of an incident but it's a simulated
incident most incidents when they when
we learn the most from them are
surprising and so if you treat them as
surprises I share in this talk a big
surprise in my life that was an incident
and it gave me one of those
inflection points where all of those
modulators came to the FL they were the
things that got me through that intense
experience that story I tell is very
personal can be a little bit triggering
so before you watch the main video be a
bit careful it is H it does touch on
some very personal very difficult
stories in there that's on purpose
because that is how we learn when the
stories are that powerful
the way I track it back to software
